identificationModule.briefTitle: A Phase Ⅰb Study on Autologous GC101 TIL Injection for the Treatment of NSCLC
identificationModule.officialTitle: An Open, Single-armed, Phase Ib Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy Using Autologous TIL in Patients With Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

descriptionModule.briefSummary: 20 participants are expected to be enrolled for the Phase Ib clinical trial，this trail is expected to be finished in 36 months.

conditions: Non Small Cell Lung Cancer Metastatic

armGroups.label: Treatment Arm
armGroups.description: Participants with advanced NSCLC using cryopreserved GC101 TIL

interventions.name: Autologous Tumor Infiltrating Lymphocytes
interventions.description: A tumor sample is resected from each participant and cultured ex vivo to generate tumor infiltrating lymphocytes. After lymphodepletion, patients are infused GC101 TIL followed low-dose PD-1 antibody.

primaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of adverse events associated with GC101 TIL retransfusion
Proportion of subjects in total cases in complete or partial response (RECIST v1.1 criteria)

secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of adverse events associated with GC101 TIL retransfusion
Proportion of subjects in total cases in complete or partial response (RECIST v1.1 criteria) during the study
Optimal efficacy recorded from the start of treatment until disease progression or relapse (RECIST v1.1 and iRECIST)
Evaluate the efficacy endpoints of DCR by the investigator with RECIST v1.1 and iRECIST
Evaluate the efficacy endpoints of PFS by the investigator with RECIST v1.1 and iRECIST
Evaluate the efficacy endpoints of DOR by the investigator with RECIST v1.1 and iRECIST
Evaluate the efficacy endpoints of OS
